thread.title: What killed Tara Palmer-Tomkinson? Tragic model had auto-immune disease which was devouring her from the inside
thread.title_full: What killed Tara Palmer-Tomkinson? Tragic model had auto-immune disease which was devouring her from the inside

author: Steve Robson
title: What killed Tara Palmer-Tomkinson? Tragic model had auto-immune disease which was devouring her from the inside
text:
Police are treating Tara Palmer-Tomkinson's mysterious sudden death as "unexplained". 
The former model was found dead at her £4.4million London flat on Wednesday afternoon aged 45. 
Police are investigating but say her death is non suspicious. 
Tara was diagnosed with a brain tumour last January after a scan revealed the growth on her pituitary gland. 
But doctors later found it was benign and not cancerous. 
However the socialite was also known to suffer from a rare and debilitating auto-immune disease. Police are investigating party girl Tara's death   
Left untreated, it would have eaten away at her insides. 
Even with treatment it could have been fatal. 
And Tara's battles with drugs were long-standing. 
Friends although she went clean for long periods, the former It girl never fully beat her cocaine habit. 
She famously spoke of it costing her £400-a-day at one point and left Tara needing septum reconstruction surgery in 2006. 
Although police are continuing to investigate, a post-mortem exam will ultimately decide her cause of death. 
An inquest into the full circumstances surrounding her death is likely to be held at a later date. 
Friends and neighbours have spoken of their sadness at Tara's death. 
She was a long-standing friend of Prince Charles and had a close relationship with the Royal Family. 
Neighbours told of how she used drive her silver BMW 645Ci "very fast and furious" down the street. 
But she was hailed as "very sweet" by the local community. 
Anne Swift said: "We always saw her driving very fast and furious in her car, she always lived life to the full. A body bag is taken from Tara Palmer-Tomkinson's house (Photo: Ian Vogler/Daily Mirror) 
"We have a resident's association and she was part of that to a certain extent. 
"As far as I am aware she was living alone." 
Another resident who lives opposite told of how Tara had told we she looked amazing several months before she died. 
The neighbour, who did not want to be named, said: "I saw her about two months ago and she seemed alright, she was with someone I knew. 
"She was always very sweet, that day she looked at me and she said 'you look amazing'. 
"It's very sad." 
The brother of Tara was abroad when she died. 
James Palmer-Tomkinson was in Switzerland working for his ski company when the former socialite was announced dead. (Photo: Getty) Police were called at around 1.40pm today   Tara was pronounced dead at the scene   
The former It girl, who more recently appeared on I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out Of Here, had recently revealed a secret year-long battle with a brain tumour. 
Doctors discovered the tumour in January last year. 
Scotland Yard confirmed police were called by the ambulance service at 1.40pm today and the death is currently being treated as unexplained. 
A spokesman said: "Police were called by London Ambulance Service at approximately 13:40hrs on Wednesday, 8 February to an address in Bramham Gardens, SW5. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
